page.title: 09LAW AND ORDER
page.content: When we interviewed Sergeant Golding he said that the main problem in the Dursley area is vandelism. The chief crime is theft, followed by burglary. He is called out to all serious and fatal accidents. His other duties include Road Safety, teaching cycling proficiency in schools, visiting libraries, play groups and pensioners. He has to visit prisoners too. When he was a Police Constable he had to attend the law court twice a month. Police men work in shifts, 10 p.m. to 6 a.m., 2 p.m. to 10 p.m. and 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. Unless they are on nightshift policemen are not usually called out at night; though they had to do night duties during the recent miners' strike. He said he enjoys most of his work.
